text: I have a fun and simple project for you
and the kids that reimagines coconut
macaroons into little bite-sized birds
nests filled with Easter candies and all
you need are three ingredients egg
whites salt and sweet and plate coconut
for the egg whites you'll need four of
them I have three in this bowl here and
let me just show you how to separate an
egg properly the whole egg goes into a
bowl and you can take half the shell or
your hand and scoop out the yolk leaving
the egg white behind it's that simple
half a teaspoon of coarse salt goes in
and just give that a whisk until it's
combined and foamy this also helps to
loosen the whites a bit and for the
coconut a fourteen ounce bag of sweet
and flaked coconut that's 5 and 1/3 cups
but we're pretty much done at this point
if you can believe it it's that simple
just stir this with your fork until it's
evenly coated and you're probably
wondering how we're going to make these
into little nests very simple really
mini muffin tins these little guys
generously coat them with nonstick
cooking spray and then we'll want about
two tablespoons of the coconut mixture
into each I'm using a 1 ounce scoop
that's the same measure as 2 tablespoons
and it makes very quick work when done
this way so just scoop it right in and
then this is the part really where the
kids can get involved the shaping of the
little nests in fact the little fingers
would do a fine job of this these would
be great for a kid's Easter egg hunt now
to shape these could use your fingers or
I like to use a thumb and you just press
it around the edges gently you don't
want to pack it down too tight you be
sure that you have plenty of coconut on
the bottom of each Cup so that it holds
together and I find that having jagged
edges at the top actually makes them
look more realistic like a nest don't
suffer and try to make them too perfect
have your oven preheated to 300 degrees
these need about 30 minutes just until
they're set and the tops are like golden
you want them still soft and chewy in
the center and just set on the edges a
voila that's it
our nests are baked and they've cooled
for about ten minutes in the tin use a
little offset spatula like this or you
could use a paring knife run it around
the edges of the baking pan and gently
lift out your macaroon these are coming
out nice and easy I'm using a nonstick
mini muffin tin if you don't have
non-stick a regular one will work just
fine looks I can get a few more on here
that might just do it okay
now for the finishing touches the
candies I like to do some with melted
chocolate dark chocolate is my favorite
but you could certainly use milk
chocolate or white chocolate if that's
what you like and just spoon some
chocolate into each cup about two-thirds
full this adds just another layer of
flavor and it looks quite pretty in
there as well
and then of course for the candy any
kind of egg-shaped candy is good I love
little Cadbury eggs or little malted
eggs jelly beans are great Jordan
almonds have that egg shape as well and
it's good to use candies in Easter
colors one right in the center and I'm
gonna distribute these throughout for
display and then a few in the plain ones
I love this already so cute and then you
can just sort of mix and match your
jellybeans the kids would certainly
enjoy being a part of this project if
you can keep them putting all the candy
in their mouth and there you have it
with just three ingredients and your
favorite Easter candies you have an
impossibly charming and delicious Easter
treat
